poem:
### Inedible Melody

Silence in cocoa,  
a tune held hostage,  
by the taste of oblivion,  
not the needle's touch.

A voice inside whispers,  
in chocolate's embrace: 
"Savor, don't listen."  
Lessons emerge, beneath  
its fragile, sweet surface.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Notes on chocolate: a seven-inch chocolate single This is a story about listening to your inner voice. Fear not, this column has not become about life coaching. But it’s all relevant. I got sent some chocolate this week, in the form of a record, a 7in ‘vinyl’ single. ‘I think you can play it,’ I gaily said. ‘No you can’t,’ said someone who will remain nameless and fancies themselves an aficionado. ‘Oh,’ I said, feeling deeply". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
